New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto allowed one hit over 6⅓ innings.
Freddie Freeman homered for the second straight night.
Tommy Edman and Teoscar Hernandez also hit home runs.
Shohei Ohtani walked off the field with a partially dislocated left shoulder.
Giancarlo Stanton's RBI single in the ninth inning.
Alex Vesia retired pinch-hitter Jose Trevino with the bases loaded for the save.
Juan Soto hit a tying home run in the third inning.
Freddie Freeman homered to right-center again.
Freddie Freeman has homered in four straight Series games dating to Atlanta's last two games against Houston in 2021.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone commented on the series being long and needing to make it a long series.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts discussed Shohei Ohtani's injury and the positive signs regarding his strength and range of motion.
Freddie Freeman reflected on the importance of the six days off between the NLCS and the World Series for his ankle recovery.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Los Angeles took a 2-0 Series lead for the first time since 1988.
The Yankees are 0-2 for the first time since 2001.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto joined the Dodgers last December for a $325 million, 12-year contract, a record for pitchers.
Yamamoto was sidelined from June 15 to Sept. 10 because of a strained rotator cuff.
All three Dodgers homers came on fastballs from Carlos Rodon.
Rodon gave up four runs and six hits in 3⅓ innings.
